intents.response: Juan C. Tallara Jr. is the assigned dean for the the College of the Engineering and Technology.

The College of Engineering and Technology offers a total of 10 undergraduate programs: 
a. Bachelor of Science in Chemical Engineering (BS ChE)
b. Bachelor of Science in Computer Engineering (BS CpE)
c. Bachelor of Science in Computer Studies major in
i. Computer Science (BSCS-CS)
ii. Information Technology (BSCS-IT)
d. Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering (BSCE)
e. Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering (BSEE)
f. Bachelor of Science in Electronics Engineering (BSEcE)
g. Bachelor of Science in Manufacturing Engineering (BS MfgE)
h. Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering (BS ME)
The vision of the College of Engineering will be the premier college in technological education, research and extension services.

The mission of the College of Engineering is guided by this vision, we commit ourselves to:

1. Uphold excellence through curriculum development and teaching, significant advances in knowledge, and services to the community of which we are a part;
2. Nurture students with a technological education of the highest quality that will enable them to be professionally competent, community directed and God centered individuals; and
3. Develop faculty members and staff to be excellent examples in leadership and management.

The College of Engineering  of the Pamantasan ng Lungsod ng Maynila was established on July 1, 1969 - six years after the late Mayor Antonio F. Villegas founded the university. Today, the College of Engineering stands committed to upholding the legacy conceived by Mayor Villegas and the late Mayor Arsenio H. Lacson by providing its present batch of Engineering students with quality education which is responsive to the needs of the time. Originally under the College of Arts and Letters, the main trust of the college was to provide technical, industrial, vocational education to PLM students alongside the humanistic courses to prepare them for promoting out technology under two divisions, namely - the Division of Engineering and Technology which covered the Department of Civil, Mechanical, Electrical, Sanitary, Chemical, Naval and Industrial Engineering and the Division of Technical and Vocational Education which covered the Department of Electronics, Wood Working, Metal Works, Automotive Works, Ceramics, Graphics Arts and Teacher Education in Arts and Trades.
The College of Engineering and Technology, commonly abbreviated as CET, provides quality education and offers technical skills in the fields of engineering and technology.

The PLM College of Engineering and Technology Student Council is one of the duly constituted student councils in the university. CET-SC aims to strengthen the camaraderie among the students within the college by providing innovative, progressive, and sustainable projects that will surely be enjoyable and will surely leave a trademark.
The PLM Chemical Engineering Students' Society, short for CHESS, is the organization under the Chemical Engineering Department.
Engr. Peniel Jean A. Gildo is the chaiperson and adviser of the Chemical Engineering Department.

The qualifications needed for interested applicants must be a 2nd year student with a GWA better than 2.25 with no failing grade in any subject and a grade higher than 2.00 in the subjects Chemistry, Physics, and Mathematics. 
Following requirements: 
- Letter of Intent (LOI)
- Shifting Form
- Proposed Study Plan
- Certification of Grade (COG) 
- Printed CRS-generated grades
- Photocopy of the ID.
Students must have atleast 1.75 GWA to qualify in the semestral academic achievers.
The PLM Association of Civil Engineering Students or ACES, is the organization for students in the Civil Engineering Department.
The chairperson of the Civil Engineering Department is Engr. Miller DL. Cutora.

The PLM CE Department shifting qualifications include a GWA of at least 2.5 or better and passing the examination.
For the requirements: 
- Letter of Intent (LOI)
- Endorsement Letter
- Certification of Grade (COG)
- Proposed Study Plan
- Curriculum Checklist
- Student Registration Form (SER)
Students must have atleast 1.75 GWA to qualify in the semestral academic achievers.
The Computer Engineering Department has an organization known as the Institute of Computer Engineers of the Philippines (ICPEP).
The chairperson from the Computer Engineering Department is Engr. Perferinda P. Caubang.
Students must have atleast 1.75 GWA to qualify in the semestral academic achievers.
The PLM Computer Science Society (CSS) is the organization for students in the Computer Science Department.
Dr. Dan Michael Cortez is the chairperson from the Computer Science Department

The requirements for shifting are as follows: 
1. Good grades in Mathematics.
2. No failing grades.
3. Scanned copy of ID of student. 
4. Letter of Intent (LOI) 
5. Scanned copy of ID of parents/guardian.
6. Summary of Grades from 1st year up to the latest semester, signed by your chairperson.
Students must have atleast 1.75 GWA to qualify in the semestral academic achievers.
The Junior Institute of Electrical Engineers, also known as JIEE, is the organization behind the Electrical Engineering Department
The current Chairperson of the Electrical Engineering Department, Engr. Andrew G. Bitancor.

The qualifications for interested shifters must fill out the form provided to upload their documents such as:
- Shifting Form
- Letter of Intent (LOI)
- CRS Grades
- Study Plan
Students must have atleast 1.75 GWA to qualify in the semestral academic achievers.
The PLM Electronics Engineering Students' Society or ECESS is the departamental organization.
The newly appointed chaiperson for the Electrical Engineering Department is Engr. Eufemia A. Garcia.

The application for shifters must have a GWA of at least 2.25 higher to qualify.
Requirements are as follows:
- Shifting Form
- Student's Registration Form (SER)
- Letter of Intent (LOI)
- Certified true copy of CRS Grades
Students must have atleast 1.75 GWA to qualify in the semestral academic achievers.
The organization for the Information Technology Department is the Society of Information Technology Enthusiats (SITE).
Prof. Criselle J. Centeno is the chairperson in the IT Department.
Students must have atleast 1.75 GWA to qualify in the semestral academic achievers.
The Society of Manufacturing Engineers, SME, is the departamental organization for the Manufacturing Engineering Department.
The chairperson in the Manufacturing Department is Engr. Samantha M. Mendoza.
Students must have atleast 1.75 GWA to qualify in the semestral academic achievers.
The PLM Student Branch of the American Society of Heating, Refrigerating, and Air conditioning Engineers, short for ASHRAE, is the organization for the Department of Mechanical Engineering.
Engr. Juan C. Tallara is the chairperson under the Mechanical Engineering Department
Students must have atleast 1.75 GWA to qualify in the semestral academic achievers.

The following are the list of the Student Affair and Services in PLM:

1. Office of Student Development And Service 
2. Scholarship Opportunities 
3. University Registrar 
4. University Library 
5. Office of the Guidance and Testing Services (OGTS)
6. University Security Office (USO) 
7. University Health Services (UHS) 
8. Other Student Welfare 
9. Student Development and Institutional Student Programs And Services

The PLM Board of Regents, Management, faculty, and staff are 
committed:

1. To be recognized by the Philippines and ASEAN academic 
accrediting agencies as a premier university for its quality 
education, research, and extension services;
2. To ensure that PLM maintains a higher than the national
average performance in all professional licensure examinations 
taken by its graduates; and
3. To continue to provide the students with an education that 
will give them a competitive advantage for employment 
opportunities.

The vision of PLM is:

Guided by the values of academic excellence, integrity and 
social responsibility, PLM is committed to pursue the principles 
of “Karunungan, Kaunlaran, Kadakilaan.”

Proper Uniform for Undergraduate Female Students
1. Blouse
- Plain white
- Baby collar
- With 5 pin tucks (each side)
- Secret button hole
- Tuck-out with paja
- No tucks at the back
2. Neck tie
- 1 yard in length by 1 inch width
- No decorative accessories, University pin may be used
- Same fabric and color with the skirt
3. Skirt
- Knee-length, pencil cut
- Blue-gray in color
- Box-pleated at the back
4. Shoes
- Plain black
- Closed (toe and heels)
Proper Uniform for Undergraduate Male Students
1. Pants
- Charcoal-gray slacks
- Straight-cut
2. Polo
- Plain white
- Untucked
- Sports-collar
- White buttons, until solar plexus
- Half polo barong
- Side slit
- No shearing, no tucks (front or back)
- Straight-cut
- No pocket
3. Shoes
- Plain black
- Closed
4. Plain black socks
5. Plain white undershirt

For Males and Females the improper school atiire are:
• Sleeveless T-shirts
• Ripped/Torn Jeans
• Leggings
• Overtight cuts
• Skinny Jeans
• Bull caps and earrings (male) 
For Females
• Plunging neckline (blouse/dress)
• Sleeveless tops with large and loose armholes
• Cleavage-baring tops
• See-through tops where the undergarment can be seen
• Mini skirt (more than 3 inches from the kneecap)
• Backless blouses/dresses
• Spaghetti-strapped blouses/dresses
• Tube-type tops blouses/dresses
• Halter and tank tops blouses/dresses
• Backless Blouses/shirts/dresses
Students are not allowed to sport tattoos.

Hi, haribon! I am ChatPLM, a simple AI trained to answer your PLM-related questions. 

I am developed by a group of passionate Computer Science students from PLM and maintained by a lot of student volunteers.

Ask me anything about PLM and I'll try my best to answer it!

Here are the contacts that you may need to have a conversation with PLM:

1. Office of the President - plm_op@plm.edu.ph (02) 8568 7027
2. Office of the University Registrar - registrar@plm.edu.ph 0916 341 0311
3. Admissions Office - admission_office@plm.edu.ph 0916 341 0332
4. Information and Communications Technology Office - ithelp@plm.edu.ph
5. Office of Students and Development Services - osds@plm.edu.ph
6. University Health Services - uhs@plm.edu.ph

The current president of Pamantasan ng Lungsod ng Maynila is,
Emmanuel A. Leyco, MPA is the former officer-in-charge of the 
Department of Social Welfare and Development (DSWD). 
He was also the former DSWD Undersecretary for Finance 
and Administration.

Aside from serving under the national government's Social 
Welfare agency, former Usec. Leyco also worked as a 
Professor at the Asian Institute of Management. He has a 
Master's in Public Administration at Harvard Kennedy School of 
Government, a Master of Arts in Organizational Psychology 
at Columbia University, and a Bachelor of Arts in Behavioral 
Sciences at De La Salle University.

This is the official hymn of the Pamantasan ng Lungsod ng Maynila:

Pamantasan, Pamantasang Mahal
Nagpupugay kami't nag-aalay
Ng Pag-ibig, taos na paggalang
Sa patnubay ng aming isipan.

Karunungang tungo'y kaunlaran
Hinuhubog kaming kabataan
Maging Pilipinong mero'ng dangal
Puso'y tigib ng kadakilaan.

Pamantasang Lungsod ng Maynila
Kaming lahat dito'y iyong punla
Tutuparin pangarap mo't nasa
Pamantasan kami'y nanunumpa.
Pamantasan kami'y nanunumpa.
PLM offers a variety of undergraduate and graduate programs, including courses in Business Administration, Education, Engineering, Law, Medicine, Nursing, Social Sciences, and more.
PLM is a public university owned and operated by the City Government of Manila.
To be admitted to PLM, you must meet the university's admission requirements, which include passing the PLMAT (Pamantasan ng Lungsod ng Maynila Admission Test) and submitting all necessary documents.

The tuition fee at PLM varies depending on the program and the student's residency status (Manila residents receive a lower rate). For the academic year 2021-2022, the tuition fee for undergraduate programs ranged from around Php 12,000 to Php 35,000 per semester.
PLM was established in 1965 as a college under the administration of the City of Manila. It became a university in 2001 and is now considered one of the leading universities in the Philippines.
PLM's main campus is located in General Luna, corner Muralla St, Intramuros, Manila, 1002 Metro Manila.
I currently don't have a list of all student organizations in PLM as I still have no data about it. Kindly give a feedback to improve my knowledge base!

The Office of Student Development and Services (OSDS) is the central student services agency, which administers and coordinates student services and represents student interests to various campus groups, the faculty, the staff, and the administration. It assumes administrative responsibility over all student organizations, student cocurricular, extra-curricular and cultural activities in the University, and facilitates and follows through student needs, growth, and development in the context of the students’ social, cultural, intellectual and moral spheres.
Prof. Lynette G. Cleto is the dean of the Office of Student Development and Services (OSDS). She is the interim head of the General Services Office as well.
For further inquiries please contact: osds@plm.edu.ph Trunkline: (+63 2) 8 643-2500.

Information & Communications Technology Office (ICTO, formerly Information Technology Center). The ICTO is a department or office responsible for managing and overseeing the information technology and communication systems within the university. In PLM, the ICTO is often in charge of a number of duties including network administration, software and hardware upkeep, user assistance, and the execution of IT rules and standards.

You can find the Information & Communications Technology Office (ICTO) inside the Pamantasan ng Lungsod ng Maynila (PLM) campus. The physical office of ICTO can be found in the Gusaling Villegas along its corridor on the ground floor near the far stairs at the end of the hallway.

It is in charge of maintaining the university's technological infrastructure, which includes computer networks, data management systems, software applications, and hardware devices. In addition, the ICTO offers technical assistance and training to professors, staff, and students on the use of technology in teaching, learning, research, and administration.

The College of Architecture and Urban Planning or CAUP was established in June of 2001 to help transform the City of Manila back into a vibrant, world-class tourist destination. The architecture program continues to relish in its own place within the university. The College prides itself of reaping numerous honors and citations for PLM, both in local and national arena. These achievements are the result of a strong partnership built around team spirit unique in PLM.

CBGM stands for College of Business and Government Management. The PLM Business School offers undergraduate and post-graduate programs that aim to make students able professionals and managers both in the private and public sector.

The college offers the following programs: Bachelor of Science in Accountancy (BSA), Bachelor of Science in Business Administration major in Financial Management (BSBA-FM), Bachelor of Science in Business Administration major in Marketing Management (BSBA-MM), Bachelor of Science in Business Administration major in Operations Management (BSBA-OM), Bachelor of Science in Business Administration major in Human Resource Management (BSBA-HRM), Bachelor of Science in Business Administration major in Business Economics (BSBA-BE), Bachelor of Science in Entrepreneurship (BS Entrep), Bachelor of Science in Real Estate Management (BS REM), Bachelor of Science in Hospitality Management (BSHM), Bachelor of Science in Tourism Management (BSTM), Master in Business Administration, and Doctor of Business Administration.

The College of Education (CEd) was formed out of reorganization and merging of colleges that were approved by the Board of Regents on June 4, 2015. It aspires to be one of the country's centers of excellence in Teacher Education. It is committed to produce globally empowered quality graduates who are proactive and catalysts of social transformation. 

The mission of the institution is to be recognized as an excellent pre-service teacher-training institution, achieve consistently high performance on the Licensure Examination for Teachers (LET), provide students with effective and relevant instruction for education locally and internationally, contribute to research efforts enhancing the quality of education in the country, and foster a culture of excellence, integrity, and responsibility.

The College of Humanities, Arts, and Social Sciences (CHASS) was formed by merging the College of Liberal Arts (CLA) and the College of Mass Communication (CMC). This reorganization was recommended by the PLM University Council and approved by the Board of Regents on June 4, 2015. Additionally, the Bachelor of Science in Social Work from the College of Human Development (CHD) and the Master of Arts in Communication Management from the Graduate School of Arts, Science, and Education (GSASE) became part of CHASS. The merger followed the vertical articulation framework prescribed by the Commission on Higher Education's Education Reform Agenda.

The College of Nursing (CN) program provides an intensive nursing practicum that will refine further the nursing competencies to ensure achievement of the Nursing program outcomes required of an entry level. The College of Nursing program aims to develop a professional nurse who is able to assume entry level positions in health facilities or community settings.

It also offers masters’ of nursing program which prepares individuals for careers in health care setting through advanced education in specific areas of expertise and to expand their career options. Program’s course content and practicum component will provide them with the knowledge and skills necessary to successfully perform the varied managerial role functions which today’s organization requires of health care practitioners and will empower them to serve as influential leaders in the design and operation of 21st century health care delivery systems.

Established in1993, the College of Physical Therapy (CPT) is among the country's best learning institutions for Physical Therapy based on its licensure exam performance. 

The college is proud of the quality of its faculty members who possess extensive clinical experience and educational background in their specialization. They bring insights from theory, practice, and research to help shape the careers of all our students.

The College of Science (CS) is one of the esteemed colleges of the university which has produced board topnotchers, leaders in the national and international levels. 

It used to be part of the College of Arts and Science, until the Board of Regents approved its proposed separation in 2002. By 2015, it offered the programs BS Psychology, MA Psychology, and MS in Mathematics Education.

The College of Law (CL) is among the the top 10 law schools based on the 2018 bar examination. It received a 51.61% passing rate in 2018 bar exams, which is higher than the 22.07% national passing rate.

PLM College of Medicine (CM) is a city government-funded medical school. Students who aspire to enroll in its Doctor of Medicine program have to pass the PLM Medical College Admission Test (MCAT). Currently, PLM is the only public medical school with a level II PAASCU Accreditation

On July 7, 2004, the Graduate School of Law (GSL) was formally launched as the second graduate school of school of law in the Philippines.

The Graduate School of Law aims to (1) develop intellectual expertise in law and jurisprudence among lawyers; (2) assist in improving public service by stressing the lawyers' mission of upholding justice and truth; (3) elevating the standards of the legal profession; and (4) enhancing the administration of justice for the welfare of the Filipino people, especially the marginalized.

The university is made up of a variety of organizations that cater to different interests and subject areas.  It consists of academic, non-academic, and religious orgs. For further queries, you can also ask for a more specific organizations from different colleges.

As of the Academic Year 2020-2021, the organizations under the College of Humanities, Arts and Social Sciences (CHASS) are Junior Social Workers Association of the Philippines PLM (JSWAP PLM), and Mass Communications Student’s League (MCSL).

As of the Academic Year 2020-2021, the organizations under the College of Engineering and Technology are Electronics Engineering Student’s Society (ECESS), Chemical Engineering Student’s Society (CHESS), Association of Civil Engineering Students (ACES), Computer Science Society (CSS), Institute of Computer Engineering of the Philippines Student Edition PLM (ICpEP .se – PLM), Junior Institute of Electrical Engineers (JIEE), Philippine Society of Mechanical Engineers (PSME), PLM Engineering Mathematical Society (PLM EMS), PLM Society of Information Technology Enthusiasts (PLM SITE), and Society of Manufacturing Engineers (SME).
As of the Academic Year 2020-2021, the organization under the College of Architecture and Urban Planning is United Architects of the Philippines Student Auxiliary (UAPSA)

As of the Academic Year 2020-2021, the organization under the College of Medicine are Brotherhood of Medical Scholars (BMS), Lingap Para Sa Kalusugan ng Sambayanan (LIKAS), Medical Alliance Rendering Service to Fellowmen (MARSF), Medical Union for Service (MUS), Philippine Medical Student’s Association (PMSA), and PhiloMedicaScientia (PMS).

As of the Academic Year 2020-2021, the organization under the College of Science are PLM Mathematical Society (PLM MathSoc), PLM Society for Biological Sciences (PLM SBS), Psychological Society (PSYSOC), and The Chemical Society (TCS).

As of the Academic Year 2020-2021, the organization under the PLM Business School are Junior Entrepreneur’s Society (JES), Junior Financial Executives (JFINEX), Junior Marketing Association (JMA), Junior People Management Association of the Philippines (JPMAP), Junior Philippine Institute of Accountants (JPIA), PLM Junior Chamber of Relators (PLM JCOR), PLM Young Economists’ Society (PLM YES), and Tourism and Hospitality Student’s Association (TAHSA).

As of the Academic Year 2020-2021, the organization that are also present in the university are Achievers in Mission (AIM), Bukluran Students’ Alliance – Integrated Student’s Organization (BSA-ISO), Christian Brotherhood International (CBI), Community Research Development Society (COMDRS), LightBearer Society (LS), Magwayen Creative Scholar’s Guild (MCSG), Movements Expert’s Society (MES), PLM Dance Iskolar Incorporated, PLM Department of Science and Technology Scholars Association (DOST SA), PLM Propaganda – PLM PPG, PLM Red Cruz Youth Council (PLM RCYC), PLM Speech and Debate Society (PLM SPADES), Public Relations Auxiliary Brigade (PRAB), Rotaract Club PLM (RC PLM), and Tugon Responding Students for Community Undertaking and Edification (TUGON RESCUE).

As of the Academic Year 2020-2021, the academic-related organizations are Junior Social Workers Association of the Philippines PLM (JSWAP PLM), Mass Communications Student's League (MCSL), Electronics Engineering Student's Society (ECESS), Chemical Engineering Student's Society (CHESS), Association of Civil Engineering Students (ACES), Computer Science Society (CSS), Institute of Computer Engineering of the Philippines Student Edition PLM (ICpEP .se – PLM), Junior Institute of Electrical Engineers (JIEE), Philippine Society of Mechanical Engineers (PSME), PLM Engineering Mathematical Society (PLM EMS), PLM Society of Information Technology Enthusiasts (PLM SITE), Society of Manufacturing Engineers (SME), United Architects of the Philippines Student Auxiliary (UAPSA), Brotherhood of Medical Scholars (BMS), Lingap Para Sa Kalusugan ng Sambayanan (LIKAS), Medical Alliance Rendering Service to Fellowmen (MARSF), Medical Union for Service (MUS), Philippine Medical Student's Association (PMSA), PhiloMedicaScientia (PMS), and PLM Mathematical Society (PLM MathSoc).
As of the Academic Year 2020-2021, the religious-related organization is Christian Brotherhood International (CBI).

As of the Academic Year 2020-2021, the non-academic organizations in PLM are Bukluran Students’ Alliance – Integrated Student’s Organization (BSA-ISO), LightBearer Society (LS), Magwayen Creative Scholar’s Guild (MCSG), Movements Expert’s Society (MES), PLM Dance Iskolar Incorporated, PLM Department of Science and Technology Scholars Association (DOST SA), PLM Propaganda – PLM PPG, PLM Red Cruz Youth Council (PLM RCYC), PLM Speech and Debate Society (PLM SPADES), Public Relations Auxiliary Brigade (PRAB), Rotaract Club PLM (RC PLM), and Tugon Responding Students for Community Undertaking and Edification (TUGON RESCUE).
At PLM, there are two organizations under its Computer Science department: the Computer Science Society (CSS) and Google Developer Student Clubs (GDSC).

Google Developer Student Clubs PLM is a duly constituted organization of Pamantasan ng Lungsod ng Maynila that aims to build great solutions, transform communities, and connect Haribons with diverse backgrounds and different majors through technology.
The PLM Computer Science Society (CSS) is PLM's main computer science organization currently led by Lambert T. Dela Cruz with advisory from Prof. Mark Christopher R. Blanco
